sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
A --- B
|     |
C --- D
```

What is the maximum number of perfect matchings that can be identified in this graph?
message_2:
In this graph, a perfect matching is a set of edges that covers all the vertices such that each vertex is incident to exactly one edge in the matching. There are two perfect matchings in this graph:

1. A-B and C-D
2. A-C and B-D

So, the maximum number of perfect matchings that can be identified in this graph is 2.
